question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 1 that all of the following are part of the process of forming limestone caves EXCEPT that

answer-list.answer-text: the lime-filled water seeps into breaks in the ground
the lime in the water evaporates
the cracks in the ground develop into caves

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, it is NOT true that stalactites
It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2

answer-list.answer-text: how the age of a stalactite is determined
what one of the effects of a limited water supply is

question.question-text: According to paragraph 3, stalagmites are NOT formed
It is NOT indicated in paragraph 3 that limestone pillars

answer-list.answer-text: result when a stalactite and a stalagmite grow together
are attached to both the floor and the ceiling of a cave
are attached to both the floor and the ceiling of a cave
are more durable than stalactites and stalagmites
